node.text:
When @kaushal and I went to New York last month, we met @scottharrison, the CEO of @charitywater – a charity that aims to give people in developing countries access to safe drinking water. From past experiences, I have had a hard time trusting charities. Therefore it was refreshing to see that private donors cover their operating costs, so 100% of all public donations can go directly to water project costs.
.
We became really moved by Scott’s story and wanted to help. Therefore, we thought it would be great to start a campaign near our 10-year-anniversary and become one of the first UK ambassadors of the charity.
.
As you may or may not know, the water crisis is one of the biggest challenges we face as a planet. So, why not focus on tackling it? We can’t solve every person in the world’s problems, but we can work together to try and overcome one of the biggest!
.
While your life may not be perfect, most of you reading this right now have it so much better than a lot of people out there. Imagine not being able to pour a clean glass of water when you’re thirsty – especially on a scorching hot day. We often take these things for granted, not realizing that for some people, being able to do something as small as this is a luxury.
.
Therefore, we’d be grateful if you could donate whatever you can to our campaign. We aim to raise a whopping £50,000, which will help approximately 2,000 people. However, whatever we raise will help those in need.
.
To donate, just click the link in my bio and select the top button. We honestly appreciate anything you can give. We’re also matching the first £5,000 raised – so it will automatically double to £10,000.
.
Btw, we’ll be getting photo updates and GPS coordinates of the communities we’ve helped so we can see where the money has gone! And, we're hoping to fly out and visit at least one of the communities we've helped together. For those wondering, your money will not be used to pay for flights or anything like that – we'll be funding it all ourselves.
.
Thank you in advance, and if you can't donate, please do not worry. Even sharing this (or the donation link) would be helpful :) 🙏🏽💫
.
#VexKing #CharityWater #WaterCrisis

node.text:
INSTRUCTIONS:

1. Exhale completely through your mouth to empty your lungs.
2. Focus on the circle at all times.
3. As the circle expands, take a deep breath in through your nose.
4. When it stops expanding, hold your breath.
5. When it becomes smaller, release your breath slowly through your mouth.
.
The timings and method I've used are important. They’re based on experimentation and research :) It may take you a while to get used to the pace, therefore, work your way up. If you have any health issues which prevent you from trying this out, please stop immediately.
.
If you practice yoga, study neuroscience, or you’re involved in change work, you may be familiar with this technique. It’s so simple that it almost seems too good to be true. It works by calming your nerves and tricking your body into thinking it’s already relaxed.
.
What we’re doing here is switching our nervous system from a sympathetic state, which is also known as our fight-or-flight response, to a parasympathetic state, which is known as our rest and digest (or calm and connect) mode.
.
During stressful times, our nervous system becomes overstimulated, which creates an imbalance. By using this technique, we are slowing down our heart rate and causing our body to relax, just as we do when we’re rested or sleeping.
.
Depending on how anxious or stressed out you’re feeling, you should repeat this breathing technique a few times over. If you are feeling very overwhelmed, repeat it over more times.
.
This technique can also be used to reduce symptoms of a migraine and help prevent muscle spasms and cramps.
.
The five-minute version can be played via IGTV. Share with anyone that may benefit from this.
.
#VexKing #AnxietyRelief #CalmAnxiety #AnxietyAttack

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by VEX KING | Self-love on August 05, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'meals During the daily grind, it's easy to forget how blessed you already are. Many of you have the comfort of a home, water, electricity, shared between family and friends. It's OK to pursue more, but it's important to know you've already got so much. and love Va king BY VEX KING INSTAGRAM: @VEXKING'.

node.text:
Drop a "THANK YOU 💚" in the comments if you're grateful for your blessings 👇🏽⁣

Let's admit it; most of us are in fortunate positions. While some of us have been stuck indoors for significant periods over the past year and a half, we forget how much of a blessing it is.⁣
⁣
I think back to my childhood when we had no home, little money, and survival was the way of life...and I offer thanks for everything I have now. While my life is far from perfect, and I don't have it all, I have so much to be thankful for, especially compared to my past. Just being in a home, knowing I can flick the heating on, get a snack out and watch a movie with my wife and dog, is a luxury. Not everyone has access to the same lifestyle.

Although my childhood was what some would consider horrendous, I also realize that so many people have had it tougher than me. I remember this to gain perspective. However, I should point out that although it's essential to be aware of your privilege and gratitude so you can shift your perception and invite more happiness into your life, it's unhealthy to minimize your struggles to avoid facing guilt and shame. 

Nevertheless, I've often found it helpful to remind myself that there are many troubles I've avoided and so many amazing things I've been given access to. I like to amplify this feeling of thankfulness with a prayer for those who might be in need.

During the daily grind, we invest in actions that will bring us closer to where we want to be. But often, we forget how much we've already accomplished. When you focus on the future, it takes a fundamental shift in awareness to witness what you've manifested in the present and see how far you've come from the past.⁣
⁣
Over the years, I've also found that there's a real power to showing appreciation.⁣ The Universe reciprocates your energy. So, if you're showing gratitude, you're going to be given more things to show gratitude for.

#VexKing

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by VEX KING | Self-love on August 03, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'People come with blessings and lessons. Everyone you connect with reflects a part of your inner being perhaps that you've ye to meet. Essentially, eeyone you encounter teaching you how to love yourself. Veking IS BY VEX KING INSTAGRAM: @VEXKING'.

node.text:
According to many ancient texts, everyone has feminine (receptive - yin) and masculine (active - yang) energies. When these energies are developed through self-love and are in a union, there is balance, harmony and joy.⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Simply put, the feminine aspect relates to intuition, and the male refers to action. When an idea inspires you, your feminine side is responsible, and when you act on it, your male side is. Both are needed for the creative process to produce a result. I like to think of it as the inner male acting on the inner female’s guidance. She advises through love, clarity and wisdom, and he responds by taking action through his direct, assertive and robust nature. Don’t take this too literally in the physical world. Otherwise, you may form a gender bias.⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Society has conditioned us to encourage suppression. A man who doesn’t support or allow the expression of his feminine energy because he fears for his identity will become dependent on a woman for emotional support and nurturing. While support and connection are natural, the problem is that one will always live in a state of fear, and thus, seek control. One cannot feel whole without someone to provide what they have hidden.⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Furthermore, your relationship with either element will manifest in the external world. For example, a woman who does not use her inner masculine energy to support herself, and instead uses it to suppress her feminine power, will feel powerless and continuously seek validation from others (usually men). Her inner masculine controls and limits her, so she will attract men who seek power and dominance over her – these men suppress their inner feminine energy. This imbalance and dependence can create chaos through manipulation and loss of one’s true nature.⁣⁣
⁣⁣
If the inner male in a woman is already supportive, and her power is not denied, she will meet men who reflect this. She won’t become “too male” and scare them off. If anything, she’ll find it easier to open up and express her feminine nature. While this is very brief, I hope you can see that the relationship with ourselves determines our relationship with others.⁣⁣
⁣⁣
#VexKing

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by VEX KING | Self-love on August 02, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'The only thing that's greater than loving yourself is seeing someone you love, finally love themselves, too. V king BY VEX KING INSTAGRAM: @VEXKING'.

node.text:
I still remember that day, many years ago, when my wife @kaushal and I were dating. She broke down and told me how she felt about herself, and how l just didn’t seem to care. Admittedly I felt like a bad boyfriend. My initial reaction was to defend myself, but I knew she was right to some extent. While I couldn’t control her perception, I could listen to her, acknowledge her feelings and review my actions. So many of my behaviours were self-focused, and I always assumed she would eventually get over things that were troubling her.⁣
⁣
When she was angry, the first thing I thought about was myself – and how it was unfair on me. I often didn’t even consider how she might have been defending her pain or how I might have provoked a wound. My actions would trigger her, and her actions would trigger me. The cycle was vicious and screamed for healing, both individually and as a pair.⁣
⁣
We realized that both of us needed to be committed to our self-love journeys – the onus wasn’t on one person. We both had to look at ourselves in the mirror and see what was hindering our outward expression of love. It felt like we were filling voids using each other – and that was a formula for deep suffering.⁣
⁣
Perhaps, when we entered our relationship, the focus was on receiving love and not giving it. But as we’ve evolved individually, so has our relationship. To love ourselves has meant that we’ve been able to love each other more purely. We’ve been able to share without any expectations and continue to love and pray for each other during the most challenging disagreements.⁣
⁣
Self-love has benefited us both. But I honestly believe, throughout the years, even though it’s been beautiful to nurture my own needs and witness selfless behaviours from my wife, the most remarkable part of the journey has been seeing her rise. Whether it’s her self-esteem expanding, the success and purpose behind her work, or the warmth in her words, it’s been an honour to witness. But nothing has moved me more than the way she’s accepted and celebrated the parts of herself that I’ve always deeply admired.⁣
⁣⁣
#VexKing

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by VEX KING | Self-love on August 01, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'Waiting to be "ready", will crush your dreams and rob the world of ceatine power. your Do it now. Do it wrong. Then, do it again. Better. Vaing BYVEXKING BYVEX KING INSTAGRAM: @VEXKING'.

node.text:
Although we often associate yoga with fitness and poses in the West, it's ultimately a spiritual, philosophical and ethical discipline set to achieve a "perfect evenness of mind." An idea that has deeply resonated with me from yogic concepts is taking action to limit mental chaos, and then owning what comes from it. The idea here is to keep action continuous (not constant).⁣
⁣
Nevertheless, our actions can be harmful – and therefore, we must infuse them with love, passion and purpose. We must also remember that, worry, fear, anxiety and doubt are all not the result of our efforts, but our mental coverage. They are limitations and hindrances set in the mind.⁣⁣
⁣
When we avoid taking action, we create more mental turbulence; we wonder what might happen, go back to what did happen, and often sink in a sea of doubt. Action helps us either: a) achieve what we set out to do or b) gives us the lessons required to achieve what we need to do. Real progress is made when an idea is acted on. We don't achieve, grow or evolve unless we get to work.⁣⁣
⁣
Sure, if you take action and something goes wrong, it has the potential to increase stress and anxiety in your life. However, when you act without an attachment to the outcome, you release the burden you place on yourself with the results of those actions. When you accept that change is constant and the key to growth, but it is only achieved through effort, you can make peace with what you do and take responsibility for what comes from your efforts. There is only fulfilment or opportunities to gain fulfilment.⁣⁣
⁣
Sometimes we are hesitant to take action because we don't know if they are the right ones to make, but by doing them, we find out if they are the right ones to take. Your answers are in your actions.⁣⁣
⁣
Step out of your mind and step into your life by owning your actions. The more you act, the more confident you will get. And although success breeds confidence, confidence also gives birth to success. You cannot lose.⁣⁣
⁣
#VexKing

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by VEX KING | Self-love on July 27, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'have control have Remember, you don't over other people's choices, you only control over your own. That's where your power is and where your focus should be. V king BY VEX KING INSTAGRAM: @VEXKING'.

node.text:
After walking around awkwardly, I finally approached one of the only tables with available seats. I hardly knew anyone at this Indian wedding my mum forced me to go to, but I was hungry. So, I quickly sat down with my plate of food and softly greeted the strangers that were already sitting at the table – without drawing too much eye contact.⁣
⁣
A few moments later, a middle-aged man sitting opposite me asked me what my name was and how old I was. He then proceeded to ask me who my parents were – this was a typical question at Indian events, even when speaking to strangers.⁣
⁣
“What’s your dad’s name?” he asked. ⁣
⁣
I replied, “He’s dead.”⁣
⁣
Usually, people would then probe for clues about my family, asking for my mum’s name or how I knew the bride and groom. However, this man paused for a moment. To my surprise, he said, “I’m sorry to hear that; life must have been hard for you and your family.”⁣
⁣
Yes, I thought – finally someone with a compassionate response who wants to understand my story. I didn’t know this man, but he took an interest in my life and even asked what challenges I’d been through. I briefly spoke about the homelessness I experienced, the violence I witnessed, and the struggle to survive. He listened to it all and told me I had a charming nature and was able to do anything I wanted with my life. I felt inspired.⁣
⁣
He then said he had to go, and to my surprise, he rolled his wheelchair away. As I sat there and contemplated how I never asked him about his life, a woman on the table looked over to me and said, “He’s such a nice man, isn’t he?” I agreed. ⁣
⁣
She continued:⁣
⁣
“You’d think with his lifelong disability after being racially attacked, rejection, and losing his entire family at a young age, he’d be somewhat pessimistic or sad. But he’s always making the most out of his life and helping others. I guess that’s why he’s lived such a happy and successful life.”⁣
⁣
‘We cannot change the cards we are dealt, just how we play the hand.’ ― Randy Pausch⁣
⁣
#VexKing

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by VEX KING | Self-love on July 26, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'Maybe people aren't leaving you; perhaps the Universe IS leaving room in your life for people who are worthy of your energy. V BYVEXKING VEX KING INSTAGRAM: @VEXKING'.

node.text:
This empowering mindset shift may bring you some reassurance during a challenging time.⁣⁣
⁣
I've always tried to keep this perspective in my life – trusting that what will be, will be for the best. This isn't to say that you shouldn't try to work for something you know deep down is right for you – and that you should give up on people easily.⁣⁣
⁣
However, we must trust the process, especially if we know that we've done everything in our power to make things work. Not everyone belongs in our life. Some people are passing by to only contribute to our evolution, while others are there to stay (even if they're not a fit at this present moment). The difference becomes clear when we tune into our intuition during moments of calm and clarity.⁣⁣
⁣
If you've been the one to leave an unhealthy relationship (for example, with a covert narcissist), then this statement still applies. You chose to walk away from someone who is no longer vibrationally compatible with you. They are no longer worthy of your new energy of courage and self-love, as you are of theirs (which is often rooted in fear rather than curiosity). After all, our experiential reality correlates to our energetic resonance.⁣⁣
⁣
You've probably heard the phrase, "not everyone you lose is a loss." We must keep this in mind, not to boost our self-image, but to identify that not everyone fits in with our greatest potential for the future. Things not working out can be an avenue to more incredible blessings.⁣
⁣
I've said this before: everyone you meet serves a purpose in your life and reflects some part of you. In a sense, people enter our lives to teach us how to love ourselves. And here's the thing, when you genuinely love yourself, you start experiencing more love through people, places and things. Ultimately, you create a life you love. Therefore, if you know you're on a transformative journey of self-love, and some spots in your life have become vacant, they will eventually be filled with those who are worthy of your energy. There is no need to rush or force anything; simply keep feeding your joy.⁣⁣
⁣
#VexKing

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by VEX KING | Self-love on July 25, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'When you have a healthy relationship with yourself, you're less likely to tolerate people who consistently treat you in unhealthy ways. Va ing ping. BY VEX KING INSTAGRAM: @VEXKING'.

node.text:
One of the most challenging tasks you’ll find as you commit to a spiritual path is trying not to cause harm while managing those who persistently try to harm you. Finding a balance is often tricky. Deep down, you’ll recognize that love and kindness is the way forward, but you’ll get tested time and time again, with people’s foul attitudes and behaviours towards you.⁣⁣
⁣
You might feel forced to tolerate people’s unhealthy ways because you identify yourself as a good person who wants to be a positive force in the world. That’s why, sometimes, you’ll try your best to appear happy and calm, when deep down, you feel exhausted, hurt and annoyed.⁣⁣
⁣⁣
You can do two things when people mistreat you: you can change your perception of them & their behaviour, or you can choose to change the situation. You might reframe the situation and look at a person’s light to seek perspective. Or you might implement boundaries and create distance. This is for you to decide, depending on what works best. ⁣
⁣
If you choose to cut ties with people who consistently hinder your growth and prevent you from finding your joy, you shouldn’t feel guilty. You’re not everyone’s saviour, you’re not perfect, and you must prioritize your mental health. You’re only human – and moving to higher states of consciousness can take a lifetime.⁣
⁣
Those who manipulate you to feel guilty for distancing yourself are usually those who harm without being accountable for their actions. They twist their insecurities and behaviours into your flaws. They’re the same people who will say you’ve changed, without questioning the influence of their actions that made you change your ways with them.⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Self-love is the balance between accepting yourself as you are, while knowing you deserve better – and then working towards it (see my book Good Vibes, Good Life). When you get to a stage where you accept yourself fully, the opinions and presence of others will have little effect on your emotional state. It may even feel like they don’t exist. Either way, if you’re practising self-love, you cannot be held captive to those that continually disrespect you.⁣⁣
⁣
#VexKing

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by VEX KING | Self-love on July 20, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'A pretty face, body shape or height might be initially attractive, but they have nothing to do with commitment, respect, understanding, compatibility, evolution and love. They won't even keep attraction in place can easily appear undesirable through their actions. someone Vaking BYVEXKING VEX KING INSTAGRAM: @VEXKING'.

node.text:
While dates are somewhat easier to arrange due to the availability and comfort of apps (minus pandemic restrictions), building healthy relationships might be a little more complicated because expectations have risen and changed. Social media and dating shows regurgitate subjective ideas on perfection when it comes to love. They encourage people to prioritize the superficial aspects, and look for the unattainable in others, while either showing severe neglect to themselves or ignorance to their growth in the process. And, when love and evolution appear to come fast and easily, people build impatience. Nevertheless, what often comes quickly, will go quickly due to the transient nature of our thoughts and emotions.⁣
⁣
People look in the wrong places, for the wrong things, and recycle the same relationships – perpetuating emotional pain. And once we account for trauma, emotional suppression and unhealthy conditioning, decision-making when approaching relationships can lead to a dark path and keep you stuck there.⁣
⁣
When your focus is on dimensions based on form and appearances, your love will not travel any deeper. People often seek relationships not to try and build a home with someone, but instead occupy rooms inside of them, hoping they’re always nicely furnished and clean. When the approach to finding love is driven by pleasure and desire, the relationship will not move further than those things. So, when pleasure is absent and desires (such as physical intimacy) are fulfilled, the person and relationship might feel dull, exhausting and lifeless.⁣
⁣
Swipe across to read the rest… 👉🏽⁣
⁣
#VexKing

node.text:
It’s easy to get lost in hustle culture. The “go, go, go” mentality has infiltrated our social media platforms, friend circles, and workplace. This approach to life and work will leave you feeling exhausted and pressured. Even worse, many have completely lost sight of their authentic ability to create for the sake of expression and passion – and seek only to do what the world expects of them.⁣
⁣
When the world begins to measure your worth by how productive you are, it’s critical to hold on to your “whys”. Knowing why you do what you do will pull you through the moments when external influence tells you that you’re not enough.⁣
⁣
Whether you’re a creator, business mogul, budding entrepreneur, or work a 9-5, identifying why you get up every morning and suit up will keep you inspired. Resonate with your reasons so strongly that your inspiration, motivation, and outcomes are impervious to external validation or criticism.⁣
⁣
To pursue your goals is an act of the brave. There’s always going to be someone who did it better (often subjective) or faster. However, that doesn’t matter. They’re not you. Your eyes have seen what theirs haven’t, and your heart has collected a series of unique experiences no one else’s has. Now more than ever, you must build a fort around your dreams. Allow only a few well-intended hearts to influence you, so that you can pursue your passions at the pace and measure that works best for you.⁣
⁣
Never stop growing, getting better, falling down, and getting back up. Someone will always have something to say, but you must do this for you and your “whys”.⁣
⁣
And, for every time you thought you hadn’t done enough, weren’t rich enough, spiritual enough, or in some way, less than others, trust that you are and will always be ENOUGH and worthy of tremendous love.⁣
⁣
#VexKing

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by VEX KING | Self-love on July 18, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'us Normalize pursuing emotional and spiritual goals not just material ones. Most of are trying to better people, not just richer ones. be Vexking BYVEXKING VEX KING INSTAGRAM: @VEXKING'.

node.text:
I posted this on Twitter, and some people misread it right away, assuming we should avoid money. I believe in balance. We all have the right to security and material comfort so we can navigate the world and progress on our journey with ease. We have the right to look after our families, nourish our bodies, and live fulfilling lives. Once we begin to hoard and become greedy, that's where internal conflicts arise. Worldly success should not violate our moral responsibilities.⁣
⁣
With the words "not just" in this statement, a simple reframe could read:⁣
⁣
Normalize pursuing emotional and spiritual goals – "as well as" material ones.⁣
⁣
"Not just" has a more significant impact because it emphasizes the general priority amongst society. When most people refer to their goals, they're usually associated with material wealth, careers, external achievements, their bodies, experiences (often requiring money), and romance. While there's nothing wrong with any of these things, when we prioritize them over a healthy mind, we overlook the thing that actually makes happiness sustainable and contributes to a better world. I would deem physical health a high priority, too – nevertheless, due to our mind-body connection, we mustn't neglect the intangible.⁣
⁣
Sure, if you're fighting for survival, money might be the immediate priority. But take it from someone who has experienced homelessness and poverty for many years: the situation can seem better externally, but internally, you can feel worse. If your emotions aren't steady and you feel like you have no purpose in life, your days can feel darker than ever before. And when you're hurt, it's impossible not to share that hurt with others.⁣
⁣
I've found that "being" helps you with the "doing" and eliminates resistance. So when you place attention and energy on a physical goal, it comes with more ease, and you get to enjoy it because you're mind isn't wandering to imaginary timezones. If we can better manage our reactions to our emotions and return to our natural equilibrium more easily (and often), we will gage more power to shape our reality.
⁣
#VexKing

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by VEX KING | Self-love on July 13, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'The right partner will inspire you to be greater without losing your sense of self. They will encourage you to make positive changes without without changing your authenticity. Vcking BY VEX KING INSTAGRAM: @VEXKING'.

node.text:
The right partner will encourage you to love yourself.⁣⁣
⁣
As I’ve suggested in my book, #GoodVibesGoorLife, self-love is the balance between accepting yourself as you are while knowing you deserve better, and then working towards it. Self-love encourages you to become the best version of yourself. Staying stagnant, blaming the world and telling everyone else they’re wrong, is not self-love. Balancing acceptance with action-led evolution is vital to real self-love.⁣⁣
⁣⁣
When you find a healthy partner, they too will want what’s best for you, while showering you with unconditional love. It’s completely possible to accept someone for who they are while recognizing that there’s room for expansion, just like there is within all of us.⁣⁣
⁣
For example, sometimes, our past traumas and subtle impressions can hamper our ambitions. As a result, we may remain in our comfort zone, or entertain unhealthy behavioural patterns, rather than pursuing a path where we might find the most joy and value in our work. However, the right partner may come along and not only realize this, but they may provide a sanctuary for your healing so you can find the courage to go out into the world and express your passion without fear. They’ll do this because they love you, not because they want to change who you are in that moment. If anything, they’re helping you uncover who you truly are beyond the layers of distortion that cloud your perception.⁣⁣
⁣⁣
My wife has inspired me to let go of many unhealthy unconscious patterns, probably without realizing. There were ideas that I clung to which stopped me from expressing my highest self. It’s through her unconditional love and subtle guidance that I often began questioning these deeply ingrained beliefs which kept me back and stopped me from loving people at a greater capacity. If anything, I’ve become less of who I thought I was supposed to be and more of who I am. After all, we’re constantly receiving responses to us in our interactions, which we use to define our self-image – but we’re much greater than that. Pure love from a healthy partner can help you find out who you are before the world told you who you’re not.⁣⁣
⁣⁣
#VexKing

node.text:
Which one of these means the most to you? Leave me a comment below👇🏽💫⁣
⁣
You've probably seen this post around (often without my name on it or with another tag on it). This was one of the earliest posts on my page, and if you've been with me since those early days, thank you for supporting me for so long.⁣
⁣
I initially made this post for me – to keep my mind empowered. Nevertheless, I was shocked when I saw how many reshares it got. This is the latest version of this post. I decided to change some of the wording and points to align with my current outlook. However, I've still kept it very simple like the original.⁣
⁣
I know a lot of you are new to this community. I hope my words help you in some way – even if they expand your thinking a little and provide fresh ideas. I'd love it if they alleviated some of your suffering, and guided you towards more fulfilment and joy.⁣
⁣
I have two books out, which also might help. The link to these can be found in my bio. I also offer a free weekly newsletter at vexking.com. Futhemore, I have another page where I share extra content and more of my personal life: @vexkingwrites⁣
⁣
Thank you all for giving me someone to talk to via social media. For helping me grow and utilize my creativity and skills. I'm grateful for your kindness, support, time and trust. I appreciate you for being here on my journey. I will always do my best to share useful content.⁣
⁣
#VexKing
